C I R C U L A R   14/ 2006 
 
 
Terrorist outfits in the U.K. are reported to have devised a new 
modus operandi to smuggle components of an IED on board an aircraft as 
part of hand baggage to evade normal airport screening procedures.  
While the main explosive  could be in clear liquid form inside an apparently 
unopened soft drink bottle, the detonator could be concealed in a battery 
with a bulb as an initiation system and the power source for the IED could 
be a modified personal  electric equipment such as a digital camera or a 
laptop etc. Such  an IED can be used for causing an explosion in an 
aircraft. 
 
2. 
In order to prevent the smuggling on board of the above type of IED 
which may be used to commit an act of unlawful interference on an aircraft 
engaged in civil aviation operations, no liquid items/gel/paste or items of 
similar 
consistency 
(except 
medicine/ 
inhaler 
accompanied 
by 
prescription and baby food) will be allowed in the hand baggage or on 
the person of a passenger boarding the aircraft. 
 
3. 
Aircraft operators will provide vide publicity to the above instructions. 
 
4. 
The above instructions shall be implemented with immediate effect. 
 
 
 
(S.R. Mehra) 
Commissioner of Security (CA)
